image.altText: a photo peering into an empty courtroom

props.synopsis: A former Northern Territory judge is facing accusations of sexual harassment from a former associate, who claims he suggested they go to a concert together and "share a bed to save money".Â

title.children: Former judge proposed sharing a bed with associate, complaint claims

image.altText: A patch of the NT police force emblem on an unidentified officer's uniform

props.synopsis: A teenage boy has been arrested and charged with rape, aggravated assault and deprivation of liberty over an alleged "violent" and "brazen" attack on the Tiwi Islands.

title.children: Teenager charged over alleged 'violent' and 'brazen' rape of Top End worker

image.altText: Blurred figures in hospital uniforms walking through a hallway.

props.synopsis: The code yellow is the first to be called in almost a year at Royal Darwin Hospital and follows pressure from organisations representing staff.

title.children: Code yellow emergency called at NT hospital after pressure from AMA, unions

image.altText: Uniformed police officers speaking to a man in a blue shirt which reads "police diver".

props.synopsis: Police divers are searching Edith Falls, near Katherine, for the body of a 57-year-old interstate tourist who witnesses saw slip below the water after he started struggling while swimming.

title.children: Divers scour 25m-deep waters in search of tourist's body

image.altText: Aboriginal man with grey hair.

props.synopsis: With many of Australia's Indigenous languages at risk of being lost forever, leaders from more than 30 Top End communities have come together to develop a plan to protect them.

title.children: Fears Aboriginal languages are being lost, as communities work to save them

image.altText: An Aboriginal man with a white moustache and beard, white hair, red vest over black shirt with a sombre expression.

props.synopsis: Kumanjayi Walker's family members have welcomed the Northern Territory coroner's findings after six years of waiting for answers. As they mourn the death of another loved one, they say the fight for justice isn't over.

title.children: 'We felt racism killed Kumanjayi': Yuendumu responds to coronial finding

image.altText: Cameron Munster closes his eyes on the field after a State of Origin game.

props.synopsis: Cameron Munster has enough legendary State of Origin performances to put him among the all-time greats, but this one felt like it was just for him, his family and his mates.

title.children: Amidst grief, Munster delivers iconic Origin after father's death

image.altText: Queensland Maroons players celebrate in the locker room.

props.synopsis: If ever there was a game that proved all the State of Origin hyperbole and jabber were true, Queensland's victory to seal the 2025 series was it.

title.children: Spurred by criticism, history and unity, the Maroons find perfection

image.altText: Abhishek Shukla wears glasses as he sits in an empty room and takes a selfie.

props.synopsis: An Australian academic who made a film about the dark side of social media manipulation has been arrested by Indian police over allegations he fleeced a divorced woman.

title.children: Australian man accused of fleecing woman of $645k in alleged marriage scam

image.altText: Jillian Segal

props.synopsis: A sweeping plan to defeat antisemitism by the government's hand-picked envoy Jillian Segal is expected to be released to government today, with recommendations that would require new legislation to enact, as well as longer-term aims to improve understanding of Jewish culture.

title.children: Sweeping antisemitism plan expected to be handed down

image.altText: Francesca Albanese holds one finger up while addressing the National Press Club

props.synopsis: The Trump administration has imposed sanctions on one of the UN's top advocates for Palestinian rights, Francesca Albanese, accusing her of "spewing unabashed antisemitism".

title.children: Trump administration sanctions UN human rights rapporteur

image.altText: A close up photo of Donald Trump speaking to reporters at a cabinet table.

props.synopsis: US President Donald Trump's threat to slap pharmaceutical exports with a 200 per cent tariff is causing uncertainty, the peak body for Australia's drug manufacturers says. Follow live.

title.children: Trump's pharmaceutical tariff threat causing uncertainty

image.altText: A CCTV camera attached to a wall.

props.synopsis: There's a crisis of trust in childcare but experts say the answer is to increase staffing and training.

title.children: Some childcare centres 'can't be bothered' turning on the CCTV, insiders reveal

image.altText: A woman with short grey hair, wearing a dark suit jacket over a white shirt, looks intently into the camera.

props.synopsis:
Former RBA assistant governor Luci Ellis describes the decision by the monetary policy board to wait before cutting rates again as "uncharitable".

Â

title.children: 'Unconfident': RBA risks falling into persistent policy error, warns former assistant governor

image.altText: Nvidia logo displayed on a mobile phone screen with a circuit board in the background.

props.synopsis: A milestone for Nvidia has boosted the market mood overnight. The ASX is poised to follow Wall Street higher. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.Â

title.children: Chipmaker Nvidia becomes first company to hit $US4 trillion

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: First Guardian investors warned super may never be recovered

'Why on earth wait?', asks former RBA official

image.altText: A man walks through a smouldering plane wreckage

props.synopsis: Among the 298 passengers and crew on board the Malaysia Airlines flight were 38 Australian residents and citizens.

title.children: Europe's top court rules Russia responsible for downing MH17

image.altText: Novak Djokovic plays a shot between the legs at Wimbledon.

props.synopsis: Chasing a 25th major singles title, Novak Djokovic gets past Flavio Cobolli in the quarterfinals, while world number one Jannik Sinner also wins through to the last four.

title.children: Djokovic survives early scare to set up Wimbledon clash with Sinner

image.altText: a graphic of Grok

props.synopsis: Elon Musk's artificial intelligence firm has deleted "inappropriate" antisemitic and pro-Hitler Grok posts, as TÃ¼rkiye and Poland cracked down on the chatbot for offensive comments.

title.children: Musk's AI firm deletes Grok posts praising Hitler as X chief executive resigns

image.altText: A koala moves along the ground with a black and red cube, about the size of its nose, attached below its chin.

props.synopsis: Koalas spend 20 hours a day sleeping, and most of the rest eating. But a new study focuses on a tiny fraction of the day when they're at their most vulnerable.

title.children: Koalas spend just a few minutes risking their lives on the ground each day

image.altText: Parts of an Air India plane that crashedare seen on top of a building near trees with snapped branches.

props.synopsis: A preliminary report into the deadly crash of an Air India jetliner in June is expected to be released this week, focused on the jet's fuel switches.Â

title.children: Air India crash investigators to focus on fuel switches in early report

image.altText: Christian Horner, a caucasian male with stubble, on an F1 pitwall staring to the side.

props.synopsis: Red Bull has sacked team principal Christian Horner after 20 years in the position, the Formula 1 team has announced.

title.children: Red Bull sacks team principal Christian Horner with 'immediate effect'

image.altText: concrete bridge suspended above river with section missing with people underneath in boats

props.synopsis: At least nine people were killed after a bridge over a river collapsed in India's western Gujarat state, which has received heavy rains in recent days.

title.children: At least nine dead after bridge collapse in Gujarat state in western India

image.altText: Parts of a regional highway that shows both sealed roads and washed away portions

props.synopsis: Businesses and pastoral stations in the Channel Country region of far-north-east South Australia could be stranded for up to eight months, after Cooper Creek's only barge was taken away for servicing two years ago. Â

title.children: Residents still cut off by floodwater angry over lack of planning

image.altText: a firefighter battles a blaze

props.synopsis: Russia has fired a record 728 drones at Ukraine, hours after US President Donald Trump aimed unusually sharp criticism at Russia's president.

title.children: Russia fires record drone attack at Ukraine after Trump criticises Putin

image.altText: A man wearing a blue jacket and a beanie stands in the entrance of an apartment block

props.synopsis: A man has been forced to launch his own legal action against the developer of his Sydney apartment building, after it ignored the regulator's order to fix fire safety issues.

title.children: Not a single NSW developer fined despite not fixing defects

image.altText: Selfie shot of woman lying on grass, wearing white tshirt. She has brown hair and a necklace.

props.synopsis: The WA Police major crime squad has been called in to help the search for 26-year-old Carolina Wilga in the Wheatbelt.

title.children: Search intensifies for German backpacker missing for more than a week

image.altText: A close up of an embryo being created with scientific equipment in a lab.

props.synopsis: The Queensland government says it needs more time to consult on a suite of new laws which would force IVF providers to notify health authorities of "serious adverse events".

title.children: Laws to force IVF providers to notify 'serious adverse events' delayed

image.altText: A man wearing a red cross shirt hand a bottle of water to a woman who is in a line.

props.synopsis: A study has found around 2,300 people have died due to heat-related causes after a severe heatwave hit Europe last week.

title.children: European heatwave caused 2,300 deaths, rapid scientific analysis says

image.altText: An email reads: "1 new myGov notification. 1 new Secure message(s). To Review please click on the View message button below

props.synopsis: Scammers are poised to capitalise on the eagerness and financial anxiety of Australians during tax time. Here's how to keep your information safe.

title.children: Received messages claiming to be from the ATO or myGov? It could be a scam

image.altText: a graphic of a pile of documents

props.synopsis: An expert says seeing what was meant to be hidden from a document detailing concerns about youth detainees offers a rare glimpse into what the public is allowed to know.

title.children: Unredacted document provides insight into information requests

image.altText: A closeup shot of a stovetop gas ring burning bright blue with a flicker of orange against a black background

props.synopsis: Authorities warn homeowners to have regular safety checks on gas appliances after a house fire started by a suspected LPG explosion fatally injured an elderly northern NSW man.

title.children: Warnings over 'catastrophic' gas leaks after home blast kills 85yo

image.altText: Woman who lost arm during lion attack

props.synopsis: A woman who lost an arm but survived a lion attack at a Queensland zoo is identified by her family as Forbes teacher Joanne Cabban.

title.children: NSW school teacher named as Darling Downs Zoo lion attack victim

image.altText: A woman signing Auslan in front of a colourful flag with a lit up stage in the distance

props.synopsis: While familiar at emergency announcements and press conferences, Auslan interpreters are now becoming increasingly common at concerts.

title.children: Why interpreting live music through Auslan is about more than just lyrics

image.altText: Superman stands in an icy cave in front of big, metal doors

props.synopsis: After the success of his Guardians of the Galaxy trilogy, director James Gunn brings wisecracks, cartoonish violence and sincerity to America's marquee superhero.

title.children: DC Studios attempts a reputation reset with light and fun Superman
